_exec_summary.SummaryText:
FCI Executive Summary



Accidental Release Prevention & Emergency Response Polices:  

FCI management is committed in maintaining the safe usage of Aqua Ammonia in the workplace.



Safety procedures include official onsite training and on-the-job training exercises.  Material Safety Data Sheets and other chemical related safety information are readily available to employees.



Facility & Regulated Substances:   

FCI receives stores, uses, and ships Aqua Ammonia.  This is a small portion of the facility's business.  The facilities primary role is a fertilizer, blending and distributing facility.  The facility has one 20,000 gallon storage tank.  The facility receives inbound Aqua Ammonia by tanker truck.  The tank system is used for storage of the material until it is sold for use to a customer or used in fertilizer blending. 



Worst-case Scenario:

The Worst-case scenario would be the release of the entire volume of the storage tank into the containment area.



Alternate-release Scenario:

The Alternate-release scenario would be the release of the substance from a hose leak with employee intervention by closing a valve; the release being captured by the containment area. 



General Accidental Release Prevention Program:

Preventative measures in place consist of inspections, and regular maintenance inspection/evaluation of all equipment. 

Operating and maintenance procedures are in place.  Training programs for employees are reviewed and kept up to date.



Five Year Accident Plan: 

FCI has had no accidental releases within the last five years.  



Emergency Response Program:  

In the event of an emergency, coordination has been established with the Hoke County Emergency Management Services.

Employees have been informed of the Emergency Response Plan. 



Upcoming Changes to Safety Procedures: 

Equipment, procedures and training programs are being reviewed and updated to improve the safety required by the ongoing review process.  Contracted with consul
tant to provide assistance with Risk Management Program.
